alert.note: Alert for Colquitt (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 18 at 9:11PM EDT until May 18 at 11:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHERN COLQUITT COUNTY... At 911 PM EDT, Doppler Radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the warned area with between 3 and 4 inches of rain over the last 2 hours. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area over the next 2 hours. Law enforcement reported flash flooding is already occurring with water over Georgia Highway 111 near Dunn Road. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Moultrie, Riverside, Moultrie Municipal A/P, Murphy, Autreyville and South Moultrie. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
